FuncDef:
The vtep-src command configures a source VXLAN tunnel endpoint (VTEP) address for a VXLAN tunnel in a BD instance.
The undo vtep-src command deletes the configuration. The vtep-src command configures a source VXLAN tunnel endpoint (VTEP) address for a VXLAN tunnel in a BD instance. The undo vtep-src command deletes the configuration. By default, a VXLAN tunnel in a BD instance uses the source address configured on an NVE interface as the source VTEP address. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Configures an IP address for the source VTEP of the VXLAN tunnel bound to a BD instance.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: Warning: All static entry configurations related to static VXLAN tunnels in the current BD will be deleted, including static MAC addresses, static ARP entries, and static ND entries. Continue? [Y/N]:Y
